This sword, one of the rare dragon weapons, came from the tail of the stone dragon of Ash Lake, descendant of the ancient dragons.
Its great mystical power will be unleashed when wielded with two hands.

weapons.name: Dragon King Greataxe
weapons.notes: Can be augmented. Grants 20 points of
weapons.description:
This axe, one of the rare dragon weapons, is formed by the tail of the Gaping Dragon, a distant, deformed descendant of the everlasting dragons.
The axe is imbued with a mystical power, to be released when held with both hands.

weapons.name: Dragon Tooth
weapons.description:
Created from an everlasting dragon tooth. Legendary great hammer of Havel the Rock.
The dragon tooth will never break as it is harder than stone, and it grants its wielder resistance to magic and flame.

weapons.name: Dragonslayer Greatbow
weapons.description:
Bow of the Dragonslayers, led by Hawkeye Gough, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.
This bow's unusual size requires that it be anchored to the ground when fired. Only uses specialized great arrows.

weapons.name: Dragonslayer Spear
weapons.description: Cross spear born from the soul of Ornstein, a Dragonslayer guarding Anor Londo cathedral. Inflicts lightning damage; effective against dragons. Two-handed thrust relies on cross and buries spear deep within a dragon's hide, and sends human foes flying.

weapons.name: Drake Sword
weapons.notes: Two-handed Strong Attack sends out a powerful shockwave down a narrow corridor at the cost of 30
weapons.description:
This Sword, one of the rare dragon weapons, is formed by a drake's tail. Drakes are seen as undeveloped imitators of the dragons, but they are likely their distant kin.
The sword is imbued with a mystical power, to be released when held with both hands.

weapons.name: Eagle Shield
weapons.description:
Greatshield with an eagle design. Lightest and easiest greatshield to handle.
Greatshields are very stable, and deflect attacks. But one cannot parry, and instead bashes with the shield.

weapons.name: East-West Shield
weapons.description:
A wooden kite shaped shield. It is decorated with the ancient symbol of a double-headed eagle, painted yellow.
Wooden shields are lighter than metal shields, but with lower physical damage reduction, and reduced shield stability.

weapons.name: Effigy Shield
weapons.description:
Frightful occult shield. Defends against divine weapons and lightning.
In an ill-fated plot to destroy the very gods, the followers of the occult once attempted to steal the power of Gravelord Nito, the first of the dead.

weapons.name: Estoc
weapons.description:
The largest of the thrusting swords. Can pierce an armored knight in one thrust.
The blade is also sharp, allowing slicing as well.

weapons.name: Flamberge
weapons.description:
This greatsword with an undulating blade is the choice weapon of the slithering serpent men of Sen's Fortress.
This weapon is designed to flay the skin and causes heavy bleeding.

weapons.name: Four-Pronged Plow
weapons.description:
Four-pronged Plow wielded by the wooden scarecrows, serfs of the forest Sanctuary.
The scarecrow serfs would not normally use these four pronged plows as weapons, but their sharpness makes them very deadly.

weapons.name: Gargoyle Tail Axe
weapons.description:
Sliced tail of the gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church or patrolling Anor Londo.
Can be used as a bronze battle axe. Bends dramatically during large attacks, owing to its nature as a tail.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Halberd
weapons.description:
Halberd of the gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church.
Perfectly standard bronze halberd without any special power.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Shield
weapons.description:
Bronze shield of the gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church.
The gargoyle's skin is tough by itself, and perhaps its shield may have been a prop, for it is a rare example of a metal shield that does not reduce physical damage 100%.

weapons.name: Ghost Blade
weapons.notes: Has unique moveset. Can deal damage to the Ghosts in New Londo Ruins.
weapons.description:
The ghosts of New Londo clutch this wickedly sharp dagger with their bony hands and make mincemeat of the living.
One of the cursed weapons which can inflict damage upon ghosts.

weapons.name: Giant Shield
weapons.description:
Greatshield made of bronze and marcasite. Used by the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.
Marcasite, or white iron, is effective against non-physical damage, but as the shield is designed for the giant sentineles, its weight is unbearable.

weapons.name: Giant's Halberd
weapons.description:
Large halberd made of old brass, used by the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.
Brass contains traces of lightning, but as the halberd is designed for the giant sentinels, its weight is unbearable.

weapons.name: Gold Tracer
weapons.notes: Parry replaced by off-hand attack. Bleed buildup is 30 per attack.
weapons.description:
Curved sword used by the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.
Ciaran brandishes her sword in a mesmerizing dance, etching the darkness with dire streaks of gold.

weapons.name: Golem Axe
weapons.description:
An Axe born from the soul of the Iron Golem, guardian of Sen's Fortress who repelled countless heroes who sought Anor Londo.
Its powerful one-handed attack imitates the golem's blade of wind, but the heavy iron blade makes it quite unwieldy.

weapons.name: Gough's Greatbow
weapons.description:
Greatbow used by Hawkeye Gough, of Lord Gwyn's Four Knights, for dragon slaying.
This bow is larger than even those used by the famed Dragonslayers. Only their leader, Gough, had the strength to handle it.

weapons.name: Grant
weapons.description:
A legendary weapon of the Way of White, granted to an Undead paladin long ago.
This mass of iron can only be lifted by those with inhuman strength, but it is blessed, and very effective against agents of Dark.

weapons.name: Grass Crest Shield
weapons.notes: Raises stamina regeneration speed when equipped
weapons.description: Old medium metal shield of unknown origin. The grass crest is lightly imbued with magic, which slightly speeds stamina recovery.

weapons.name: Gravelord Sword
weapons.description:
Sword wielded only by servants of Gravelord Nito, the first of the dead. Crafted from the bones of the fallen.
The miasma of death exudes from the sword, a veritable toxin to any living being.

weapons.name: Great Club
weapons.description:
Giant tree branch serves as a wooden club. Smashes enemies from upside the head.
The leaping attack is a trademark of clubs, and this giant club is no exception.

weapons.name: Great Lord Greatsword
weapons.description: Greatsword born from the soul of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder. As bearer of the ultimate soul, Gwyn wielded the bolts of the sun, but before linking the fire, divided that power amongst his children, and set off with only this great sword as his companion.

weapons.name: Great Scythe
weapons.description:
Weapon with a long curved blade. Converted from a wheat-harvesting tool.
The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work.

weapons.name: Greataxe
weapons.description:
This greataxe is a veritable mass of iron. Its weight sends foes flying, but it makes it difficult to handle without inhuman strength.
Any miss makes one very vulnerable, as each swing requires the full force of the body.

weapons.name: Greatshield of Artorias
weapons.description:
Shield born from the soul of the great grey wolf Sif, guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias.
Boasts consistent defense and divine protection against various status effects.

weapons.name: Greatsword
weapons.description:
One of the gigantic straight greatswords.
Very few have what it takes to wield this incredibly heavy, damage-dealing monster. A favorite of the Knights Berenike, known for their heavy armor, and Black Iron Tarkus.

weapons.name: Greatsword of Artorias
weapons.description:
Sword born from the soul of the great grey wolf Sif, guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias.
Sir Artorias hunted the Darkwraiths, and his sword strikes harder against dark servants.

weapons.name: Greatsword of Artorias
weapons.description:
Sword born from the soul of the great grey wolf Sif, guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias.
Sir Artorias hunted the Darkwraiths, and his sword strikes harder against dark servants.

weapons.name: Guardian Tail
weapons.description:
Sliced tail of the Sanctuary Guardian.
This flexible, spiked and highly poisonous tail would make a rather obnoxious weapon.

weapons.name: Halberd
weapons.description: Long-hilted weapon mixing spear and axe is difficult to handle, requiring both strength and dexterity. The Halberd has two elementary attacks: spear-like thrusting and large sweeping swings. However, one false swing and the wielder is left wide open.

weapons.name: Hammer of Vamos
weapons.description:
Metal hammer of Vamos, a skeleton blacksmith deep within the Catacombs who rarely speaks.
Can be used as a strike weapon, but better left in the hands of its talented owner.

weapons.name: Hand Axe
weapons.notes: Weak attack replaced by a quick horizontal swing that can be followed up by additional inputs.
weapons.description: Small hand axe. Appears identical to a lumberjack's tool, but has ideal weight and strength, and is easy to handle. One wrong swing leaves the wielder wide open, so timing and proximity to the enemy must be judged carefully.

weapons.name: Havel's Greatshield
weapons.notes: Bash replaced by a stoneskin buff.
weapons.description:
Greatshield of the legendary Havel the Rock. Cut straight from a great slab of stone.
This greatshield is imbued with the magic of Havel, proves a strong defense, and is incredibly heavy. A true divine heirloom on par with the Dragon tooth.

weapons.name: Heater Shield
weapons.description:
Small metal shield. A standard, widely-used shield.
This shield is easy to use, and is one of the smallest shields that offers 100% physical damage reduction.

weapons.name: Hollow Soldier Shield
weapons.description: Metal shield wielded by Hollow soldiers. Heavily rusted but sturdy, providing a strong defense.

weapons.name: Iaito
weapons.description:
Katana forged in an Eastern land. The Katana is drawn from the scabbard at lightning speed, using an Iaijutsu technique.
Iaijutsu allows the wielder to charge forward to swiftly cut down distant foes.

weapons.name: Iron Round Shield
weapons.description:
Thick iron shield of Shiva of the East. Heaviest of the standard shields. Deflects enemy attacks.
A famous specimen from Shiva's collection, but none who have faced it have lived to tell the tale.

weapons.name: Ivory Talisman
weapons.description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Ivory Talismans are granted only to female clerics, and their value is affected dramatically by their owner's faith.

weapons.name: Izalith Catalyst
weapons.description: Catalyst of the Witch of Izalith of long ago, when her daughters were still flame witches, before they were engulfed by the Chaos Flame. Before the birth of pyromancy, their wands were mediums for sorcery, but knowledge of this flame sorcery has long since vanished.

weapons.name: Jagged Ghost Blade
weapons.notes: Has unique moveset. Can deal damage to ghosts.
weapons.description:
Jagged blade wielded by New Londo ghosts. Violent thrust attack.
One of the cursed weapons. Inflicts damage to ghosts.

weapons.name: Knight Shield
weapons.description:
This medium metal shield is elegantly carved and painted.
Although it is thought to have been used by ancient knights of nobility, its defense and capabilities are similar to other shields.

weapons.name: Large Club
weapons.description:
Large wooden club.
The giant Undead of Blighttown wield these clubs, which became poisonous from the influence of their surroundings.

weapons.name: Large Leather Shield
weapons.description:
Large, leather-covered round shield. Choice shield for hunters.
Wood shields are lighter than metal shields, but with lower physical damage reductions, and reduced shield stability.

weapons.name: Leather Shield
weapons.description:
Round leather-covered shield. A standard, widely-used shield.
Small shields are always less stable, but landing critical hits after parry is easier.

weapons.name: Lifehunt Scythe
weapons.description: Scythe born from the soul of Priscilla, the stark white crossbreed trapped inside the Painted World of Ariamis. Even the Gods feared Priscilla's lifehunt ability, and in the hands of a mortal, its power will turn upon its wielder.

weapons.name: Light Crossbow
weapons.description: Standard crossbow issued to soldiers. While bows require both hands, a crossbow is held in one, but arming each bolt takes time.

weapons.name: Logan's Catalyst
weapons.description: Catalyst of Big Hat Logan, the great sorcerer and seeker of knowledge. Originally the same catalyst employed by the Vinheim sorcerers, only terribly strengthened over time due to Logan's use. Very powerful when used by one of superior intelligence.

weapons.name: Longbow
weapons.description:
Large bow. Projectile weapon for experienced hunters. Equip arrows to use.
Hold bow and press L1/RB to aim. Aim for heads of humanoid foes. Press L2/R2 to change type of arrows.

weapons.name: Longsword
weapons.description:
Widely-used standard straight sword, only matched in ubiquity by the Shortsword.
An accessible sword which inflicts consistent regular damage and high slash damage, making it applicable to a variety of situations.

weapons.name: Lucerne
weapons.description: Halberd with a large, hard beak-like protrusion. Inflicts thrust damage. Instead of thrusting like a spear, the wielder of the Lucerne aims to club the head with its hard beak.

weapons.name: Mace
weapons.description: Iron hammer with a protrusive pommel. Standard weapon for clerics. This simple bladeless strike weapon is effective against most foes, and can break the guard of a shield. However, one miss leaves one wide open.

weapons.name: Mail Breaker
weapons.description:
Standard small thrusting sword. Unsharpened but pointed solid shaft can pierce tough armor.
Can be thrust using one's body, and is very effective for critical attacks.

weapons.name: Man-serpent Greatsword
weapons.description:
This single-bladed blood-stained greatsword is the choice weapon of the slithering serpent men of Sen's Fortress.
An ordinary human will have great difficulty swinging this heavy beast effectively.

weapons.name: Manus Catalyst
weapons.notes: Boosts power of both soul and Dark sorceries, but reduces number of casts.
weapons.description: A sorcery catalyst born from the soul of Manus, father of the Abyss. A rough, old wooden catalyst large enough to be used as a strike weapon. Similar to the Tin Crystallization Catalyst, it boosts the strength of sorceries, but limits the number of castings.

weapons.name: Moonlight Butterfly Horn
weapons.description:
Weapon born from the mystical creature of Darkroot Garden, the Moonlight Butterfly.
The horns of the butterfly, a being created by Seath, are imbued with a pure magic power.

weapons.name: Moonlight Greatsword (Dark Souls)
weapons.description:
This sword, one of the rare dragon weapons, came from the tail of Seath the Scaleless, the pale white dragon who betrayed his own.
Seath is the grandfather of sorcery, and this sword is imbued with his magic, which shall be unleashed as a wave of moonlight.

weapons.name: Murakumo
weapons.description:
Giant curved sword forged using special methods in an Eastern land.
This unparalleled weapon cuts like a Katana but is heavier than a Nata machete. Requires extreme strength, dexterity, and stamina to wield.

weapons.name: Notched Whip
weapons.notes: Build-up is 33 per attack even if blocked.
weapons.description:
Whip with sharp spikes.
Only slightly effective against armor and tough scales, but quite formidable against enemies with exposed skin. Also causes heavy bleeding.

weapons.name: Obsidian Greatsword
weapons.notes: Can be augmented. Has unique special attack.
weapons.description:
This greataxe,
The mystical power of its obsidian blade will be released when held with both hands.

weapons.name: Oolacile Catalyst
weapons.description:
Sorcery catalyst of the lost land of Oolacile. Formed by enchanted whitebark branches.
Boosts sorcery adjustment, but lost land sorceries are not offensive, and attacks are not affected by intelligence.

weapons.name: Oolacile Ivory Catalyst
weapons.description: Sorcery catalyst of the lost land of Oolacile. Formed by enchanted whitebark branches. The whitebark boosts sorcery adjustment, but the sorceries of this lost land are gentle and not affected by intelligence.

weapons.name: Painting Guardian Sword
weapons.notes: Inflicts bleed by 30 points per hit.
weapons.description:
Curved sword of Anor Londo painting guards. Unique shape with flat tip.
The guardians, who strike down those who dare threaten the painting, attack in a continuous, circular dancing motion, a technique passed down through generations.

weapons.name: Parrying Dagger
weapons.description:
This dagger is useful after parrying and is normally equipped in the left hand.
A favorite of the knights of Carim, who are famous for fighting without a shield.

weapons.name: Partizan
weapons.description:
Spear with a blade attached to a broad point. Boasts long reach, and can slice.
The wide range of this spear makes it adaptable to many situations. Its strength lies in its length, but in cramped quarters, this backfires, and slices ricochet off walls.

weapons.name: Pickaxe
weapons.description:
Traditionally a mining tool, but the hard cone of the pommel is effective in battle.
A downward swing of the Pickaxe can crush stone; a human head would be an afterthought.

weapons.name: Pierce Shield
weapons.description:
Shield of certain knights of Catarina, used in attacks with a large protrusion in the center.
Can be used as a thrust weapon.

weapons.name: Pike
weapons.description: Long spear with a very long red hilt. Traditionally used by groups of soldiers. Specially designed for distance thrusting. Has the longest range of all non-projectile weapons, but its very length makes it somewhat difficult to handle.

weapons.name: Plank Shield
weapons.description: Makeshift shield built from wood planks. Provides minimal protection, but at a cost of moderate humiliation.

weapons.name: Priscilla's Dagger
weapons.description:
This sword, one of the rare dragon weapons, came from the tail of Priscilla, the Dragon Crossbreed in the painted world of Ariamis.
Possessing the power of lifehunt, it dances about when wielded, in a fashion reminiscent of the white-robed painting guardians.

weapons.name: Quelaag's Furysword
weapons.description: A curved sword born from the soul of Quelaag, daughter of the Witch of Izalith, who was transformed into a chaos demon. Like Quelaag's body, the sword features shells, spikes, and a coating of chaos fire. Power affected by wielder's humanity.

weapons.name: Rapier
weapons.description:
Standard thrusting sword. Regular one-handed attack can be delivered with shield held up. Can parry with use of left hand.
Thrusting attacks pierce and are effective against foes with hard exteriors, but the wielder is left open to damage after a swing.

weapons.name: Red & White Round Shield
weapons.description:
Round wooden shield crafted in Lordran featuring an impressive red and white design.
The giant trees in Lordran are distant offspring of the great stone archtrees. This shield inherits their properties, and the wood greatly reduces magic damage.

weapons.name: Reinforced Club
weapons.notes: Bleed build-up is 30 per hit, and once inflicted, deals 30% of the enemy's total HP.
weapons.description: A club with leather nailed to the pommel. The burg Undead merchant proudly peddles this club, but its reinforcement is shoddy. Indeed, its attack is stronger, but the club is no longer dependably sturdy.

weapons.name: Ricard's Rapier
weapons.description:
A rapier with intricate decorations. Chosen weapon of the infamous Undead Prince Ricard. Ricard's exploits are told in a monomyth.
He was born into royalty, but wandered the lands in a fateful ill-conceived journey. He became Undead, and disappeared up North.

weapons.name: Sanctus
weapons.notes: Restores 2 HP every 2 seconds when equipped
weapons.description: A legendary weapon of the Way of White, granted to an Undead paladin long ago. Once blessed with the protection of a white flame, but its power has all but faded, so that it provides only slight HP recovery.

weapons.name: Scimitar
weapons.description:
Small curved sword. Each hit inflicts little damage, but fluid chain attacks are deadly.
The scimitar's sharp slashing attacks are effective against cloth and flesh, but not against metal armor or tough scales.

weapons.name: Scythe
weapons.description:
Halberd with a large blade. Scythe adjusted for battle.
Designed especially for slicing. However, one false swing leaves one wide open.

weapons.name: Server
weapons.description:
A curved greatsword used in a mysterious ancient rite.
Imbued with a frightful occult energy which restores HP with each hit.

weapons.name: Short Bow
weapons.description:
Small bow. Standard projectile weapon. Equip arrows to use.
Hold bow and press L1 to aim. Aim for heads of humanoid foes. Press L2/R2 to change type of arrows.

weapons.name: Shortsword
weapons.description:
This small straight sword is widely used, to an extent only matched by the longsword.
An accessible sword which inflicts consistent regular damage and high slash damage, making it applicable to a variety of situations.

weapons.name: Shotel
weapons.notes: Strong attack deals 50% damage through guard.
weapons.description:
Curved sword with sharply curved blade.
Created by Arstor, Earl of Carim. Requires great skill to wield, but evades shield defense to sneak in damage.

weapons.name: Silver Knight Shield
weapons.description:
Shield of the Silver Knights of Anor Londo. A flowing canal is carved deep into its face.
The Silver Knights stayed behind in Anor Londo to defend the illusory goddess, and their shields are blessed with her divine protection.

weapons.name: Silver Knight Spear
weapons.description:
The silver knights of Anor Londo guard the city using this beautifully slender weapon.
The spear can be wielded by both hands in a focused thrust that uses one's body weight, or swung in a large sweeping motion.

weapons.name: Silver Knight Straight Sword
weapons.description:
The silver knights of Anor Londo guard the city using this beautifully slender weapon.
Its chain attacks, in which the wielder takes great advancing steps and makes use of his bodyweight, are deadly even in single hits.

weapons.name: Skull Lantern
weapons.description:
Skull Lantern of the Catacombs necromancer. Droops from his long beard locks.
This lantern alights the Tomb of the Giants, Nito's light-devouring domain of death. Also serves as a fire damage strike weapon.

weapons.name: Small Leather Shield
weapons.description:
Small, leather-covered round shield, reinforced in critical spots with metal.
Small shields are always less stable, but landing critical hits after parry is easier.

weapons.name: Smough's Hammer
weapons.description: Great hammer from the soul of executioner Smough, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo. Smough loved his work, and ground the bones of his victims into his own feed, ruining his hopes of being ranked with the Four Knights.

weapons.name: Sniper Crossbow
weapons.description:
Large crossbow with long distance used by Carim snipers. Often used with sniper bolts.
But while crossbows are normally easy to use, the Sniper Crossbow requires dexterity.

weapons.name: Sorcerer's Catalyst
weapons.description: Sorcery catalyst used by sorcerers of Vinheim Dragon School. Equip catalyst to use sorceries. Attune sorceries from a scroll at a bonfire. Most sorceries have a limited no. of uses.

weapons.name: Spear
weapons.description: Standard spear used commonly by soldiers. Long reach, and can be used with shield up. Effective against hard exteriors, and can hit for high damage at the right moment of an enemy's swing. But the hit radius is small, and it is easily blocked by shields.

weapons.name: Spider Shield
weapons.description:
Shield of the savage mountain bandits. Uniquely-shaped with a large black spider etched upon it.
Has resistance to poison.

weapons.name: Spiked Shield
weapons.description:
Shield of the infamous Darkwraith Kirk, Knight of Thorns. Covered with spikes.
Can be used as a weapon. Sharp spikes cause heavy bleeding.

weapons.name: Stone Greataxe
weapons.description:
Greataxe borne by the stone knights who guard the forest Sanctuary.
This greataxe, requiring inhuman strength to wield and more fitted to manual labor than battle, is nevertheless completely lethal.

weapons.name: Stone Greatshield
weapons.description:
Mossy round greatshield used by the guardian of the Darkroot garden, the Stone Knight.
The Stone Knight is a creation of ancient magic, and this shield is imbued with the same power, but is also extremely heavy.

weapons.name: Stone Greatsword
weapons.description:
The Stone Knights who guard the Darkroot Garden wield this moss-covered greatsword.
The same magic which created the Stone Knights is imbued in the sword. Unleash this power by wielding the sword with two hands.

weapons.name: Straight Sword Hilt
weapons.description:
The hilt of this lost sword was found discarded in the Undead Asylum.
Only slightly better than one's bare hands, and not recommended for extensive use. Be certain to find a replacement quickly.

weapons.name: Sunlight Shield
weapons.description:
Shield of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. Decorated with a holy symbol, but Solaire illustrated it himself, and it has no divine powers of its own.
As it turns out, Solaire's incredible prowess is a product of his own training, and nothing else.

weapons.name: Sunlight Straight Sword
weapons.description:
This standard longsword, belonging to Solaire of Astora, is of high quality, is well-forged, and has been kept in good repair.
Easy to use and dependable, but unlikely to live up to its grandiose name.

weapons.name: Sunlight Talisman
weapons.description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. The talisman of Solaire of Astora, the Knight of Sunlight, is decorated with a holy symbol, illustrated by Solaire himself. This talisman is a projection of Solaire's upstanding, unwavering faith.

weapons.name: Talisman
weapons.description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Standard talisman issued to common believers. Equip talisman to cast miracles. Attune miracles from a scroll at a bonfire. Most miracles have a limited no. of uses.

weapons.name: Target Shield
weapons.description:
Small round metal shield. Four protrusions used to parry attacks.
Small shields are always less stable, but landing critical hits after parry is easier. This shield is specialized for parrying.

weapons.name: Thorolund Talisman
weapons.description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods.This talisman is only granted to high ranking Thorolund clerics. Has high miracle adjustment which, thanks to divine protection, is not depended upon faith.

weapons.name: Tin Banishment Catalyst
weapons.description: Catalyst of the banishment sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal off away the Darkwraiths and the Kings who fell to Dark. In contrast to other catalysts, the metal catalyst qualifies as a weapon, as it inflicts physical damage, however small.

weapons.name: Tin Crystallization Catalyst
weapons.description:
Catalyst imbued in terrifying crystal magic. Used by Logan after his fixation on Seath.
Makes all sorceries incredibly powerful, but demands extremely high intelligence from its wielder, and halves sorcery usages.

weapons.name: Tin Darkmoon Catalyst
weapons.description: Catalyst born from the soul of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, Darkmoon deity who watches over the abandoned city of Gods, Anor Londo. Gwyndolin is Gwyn's last born and a legitimate god, but he is also a Moon sorcerer, and this wand is boosted by faith, not intelligence.

weapons.name: Titanite Catch Pole
weapons.description: Weapon of the titanite demon, a faceless stone monster born from titanite slab. One of the enchanted weapons, perhaps from residual power of the titanite slab. Known for its leaping attack which comes smashing down on foes from above.

weapons.name: Tower Kite Shield
weapons.description: Medium metal shield. Decorated with a tower, the symbol of protection. A standard, widely-used shield.

weapons.name: Tower Shield
weapons.description:
Metal Greatshield. Used by the Knight Berenike, known for his heavy armor.
This thick plate of iron is heavily defensive but ultra heavy. Greatshields are very stable, and deflect attacks. However, one cannot parry, and instead bashes with the shield.

weapons.name: Uchigatana
weapons.description:
Katana forged in an Eastern land. Known for its brisk slashing motions.
The Uchigatana cuts beautifully and causes bleeding, but its blade is easily nicked.

weapons.name: Velka's Rapier
weapons.description:
A symbolic, powerful thrusting sword used by the pardoner serving Velka, Goddess of Sin.
It is no mere symbol to be sure; the pardoner is an inhuman swordsman, and wields this enchanted blade with special sword technique.

weapons.name: Velka's Talisman
weapons.description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. This black tuft of hair that serves as a talisman belongs to Velka, Goddess of Sin. It casts miracles not by drawing upon faith, but intelligence.

weapons.name: Warpick
weapons.description:
Hammer with a large beak-shaped pommel. Originally a pickaxe; redesigned for battle.
This simple but deadly weapon hits heavily with thrust damage, such that it easily cracks metal armor.

weapons.name: Warrior's Round Shield
weapons.description:
Round wooden shield crafted in Lordran. Decorated with the ancient Labrys axe.
The giant trees in Lordran are distant offspring of the great stone archtrees. This shield inherits their properties, and the wood reduces magic damage.

weapons.name: Washing Pole
weapons.description:
Katana forged in an Eastern land. Very unusual specimen with a long blade.
The blade is extremely long, but as a result, quite easily broken.

weapons.name: Whip
weapons.description:
Leather Whip. Not intended for battle.
Virtually ineffective against armor and tough scale, but quite formidable against enemies with exposed skin.

weapons.name: Winged Spear
weapons.description: A long-hilted spear with a barbed point. Long reach, and can be used with shield up. Effective against hard exteriors, and hits for high damage at the right moment of an enemy's swing. But the hit radius is small, and it is easily blocked by shields.

weapons.name: Wooden Shield
weapons.description:
Vertically elongated wooden shield. Decorated with a white dragon.
Wood shields are lighter then metal shields, but with lower physical damage reduction, and reduced shield stability.

weapons.name: Zweihander
weapons.description:
One of the gigantic straight greatswords.
As the name suggests, the Zweihander is held with two hands, but its wielder must still be inhumanly strong. It is this great weight that sends foes flying when hit solidly.

ammo.name: Dragonslayer Arrow
ammo.description:
Giant dragon-hunting arrows, resembling iron spears.
Used by Hawkeye Gough and his Dragonslayers, they puncture human flesh easily.
Dragonslayer Arrows can only be used with the Dragonslayer Greatbow, and vice-versa.

ammo.name: Feather Arrow
ammo.description:
Red feather arrows of the Lord's hunters.
Their long range makes them effective for sniping.

ammo.name: Fire Arrow
ammo.description:
Arrows fired with flaming tips.
Inflicts fire damage.

ammo.name: Gough's Great Arrow
ammo.description:
Great arrow used by Hawkeye Gough, one of Lord Gwyn's Four Knights, for dragon slaying. Requires Greatbow.
Gough personally crafts each stone tip, and wraps the shaft tightly with tree bark.

ammo.name: Heavy Bolt
ammo.description:
Large bolt. Used mainly with the Heavy Crossbow.
These weighty bolts inflict high damage, but have reduced range.

ammo.name: Large Arrow
ammo.description:
Large Arrow.
Heavier arrows cause more damage, but have a shorter range.

ammo.name: Lightning Bolt
ammo.description:
Special bolts imbued with lightning, crafted by the giant blacksmith of Anor Londo.
The giant blacksmith has never seen a crossbow, but remembers the specifications of the bolts requested by ancient warriors.

ammo.name: Moonlight Arrow
ammo.description: Arrow granted to those bound by Covenant to the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, Lord Gwyn's lastborn. Moonlight Arrows glow silver, and inflict magic damage.

ammo.name: Poison Arrow
ammo.description:
Arrow with point dipped in poison. Ensures the demise of prey in a hunt, or the target in an assassination.
Once an enemy is poisoned, one need only wait.

ammo.name: Sniper Bolt
ammo.description: Red feather bolts used with the

ammo.name: Standard Arrow
ammo.description:
Standard Arrow.
Arrow must be equipped to be fired.

ammo.name: Standard Bolt
ammo.description:
Standard crossbow bolt. Used mainly with the Light Crossbow.
Equip crossbow with a bolt to fire.

ammo.name: Wood Bolt
ammo.description:
Basic wood bolt.
These bolts do not fly particularly far, nor do they inflict a terrible amount of damage, but their cheap cost makes them useful when volume is required.

ammo.name: Wooden Arrow
ammo.description: Standard Arrow. These arrows do not fly particularly far, nor do they inflict a terrible amount of damage, but their cheap cost make them useful when volume is required.

armor.name: Anklet of the Great Lord
armor.description:
Anklets of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked
the First Flame.

Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul,
divided that power among his clan before
linking the flame. When he departed, he
left only with his greatsword, his garb,
and the crown, now bereft of power.

armor.name: Antiquated Dress
armor.description:
A dress from the ancient fallen land of
Oolacile. Its ivory-colored silk features
elaborate embroidery and is imbued with
ancient magic power.

One cannot expect any physical protection
from this garment, as it was not meant to
be worn in battle.

armor.name: Antiquated Gloves
armor.description:
Gloves from the ancient fallen land of
Oolacile. Their ivory-colored silk features
elaborate embroidery and are imbued with
ancient magic power.

One cannot expect any physical protection
from these, as they were not meant to be worn
in battle.

armor.name: Antiquated Skirt
armor.description:
A skirt from the ancient fallen land of
Oolacile. Its ivory-colored silk features
elaborate embroidery and is imbued with
ancient magic power.

One cannot expect any physical protection
from this garment, as it was not meant to
be worn in battle.

armor.name: Armor of Thorns
armor.description:
Armor of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and notorious
member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of
thorns grows from its surface.

It is a fitting item for the murderous Kirk,
for by simply wearing it and rolling, one can
damage enemies.

armor.name: Armor of the Glorious
armor.description:
Strange armor from the ancient land of Zena,
birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.

The many medals are believed to symbolize
glory.

armor.name: Armor of the Sun
armor.description:
Armor of Solaire of Astora, Knight of
Sunlight. The large holy symbol of the Sun,
while powerless, was painted by Solaire himself.

Solaire's incredible prowess must have
come from rigorous training alone, for
his equipment exhibits no special traits.

armor.name: Balder Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by the knights of the ancient
kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick
iron plates.

Balder was the homeland of the Knight
King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a
great many Undead were spawned.

armor.name: Balder Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by the knights of the ancient
kingdom of Balder. They are made from thick
iron plates.

Balder was the homeland of the Knight
King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a
great many Undead were spawned.

armor.name: Balder Helm
armor.description:
Helm worn by the knights of the ancient
kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick
iron plates.

Balder was the homeland of the Knight
King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a
great many Undead were spawned.

armor.name: Balder Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings worn by the knights of the ancient
kingdom of Balder. They are made from thick
iron plates.

Balder was the homeland of the Knight
King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a
great many Undead were spawned.

armor.name: Big Hat
armor.description:
Gigantic hat worn by the great sorcerer
Logan. It completely hid his face, which led
to his nickname "Big Hat."

Famously antisocial, Logan used it to block
out noise and people's stares so he could
focus on his own thoughts, but it does not
possess any special magic powers.

armor.name: Black Cleric Robe
armor.description:
Robe worn by pardoners serving Velka,
the Goddess of Sin.

The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in
color and said to be imbued with Velka's
mystical power, which provides resistance
against all manner of magic.

armor.name: Black Iron Armor
armor.description:
Armor of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight
known for his great strength.

Built of a special black iron and
providing strong defense, notably
against fire, but so terribly heavy to be
unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

armor.name: Black Iron Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight
known for his great strength.

Built of a special black iron and
providing strong defense, notably
against fire, but so terribly heavy to be
unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

armor.name: Black Iron Helm
armor.description:
Helm of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known
for his great strength.

Built of a special black iron and
providing strong defense, notably
against fire, but so terribly heavy to be
unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

armor.name: Black Iron Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight
known for his great strength.

Built of a special black iron and
providing strong defense, notably
against fire, but so terribly heavy to be
unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

armor.name: Black Knight Armor
armor.description:
Armor of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.

The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he
departed to link the Fire, but they were
burned to ashes in the newly kindled flame,
wandering the world as disembodied spirits
ever after.

armor.name: Black Knight Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the Black Knights who haunt
Lordran.

The knights pursued Lord Gwyn when he
departed to link the Fire, but they were
burned to ashes in the newly kindled flame,
wandering the world as disembodied spirits
ever after.

armor.name: Black Knight Helm
armor.description:
Helm of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.

The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he
departed to link the Fire but they were
burned to ashes in the newly kindled flame,
wandering the world as disembodied spirits
ever after.

armor.name: Black Knight Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of the Black Knights who haunt
Lordran.

The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he
departed to link the flame, but they
were burned to ashes in the newly kindled
fire, wandering the world as disembodied
spirits ever after.

armor.name: Black Leather Armor
armor.description:
This armor made of smooth black leather is
extremely quiet, a good thing for those who
hide in the shadows.

The leather itself is thick, offering a
decent level of protection.

armor.name: Black Leather Boots
armor.description:
These boots made of smooth black leather are
extremely quiet, good for those who hide in
the shadows.

The leather itself is thick, offering a
decent level of protection.

armor.name: Black Leather Gloves
armor.description:
These gloves made of smooth black leather are
extremely quiet, good for those who hide in
the shadows.

The leather itself is thick, offering a
decent level of protection.

armor.name: Black Manchette
armor.description:
Manchette worn by pardoners serving Velka,
the Goddess of Sin.

The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in
color and said to be imbued with Velka's
mystical power, which provides resistance
against all manner of magic.

armor.name: Black Sorcerer Boots
armor.description:
Boots worn by the secret sorcerers at
Vinheim Dragon School.

They secretly work with sound-based spells,
and never reveal themselves.

armor.name: Black Sorcerer Cloak
armor.description:
Cloak worn by the secret sorcerers at
Vinheim Dragon School.

They secretly work with sound-based spells,
and never reveal themselves.

armor.name: Black Sorcerer Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by the secret sorcerers at
Vinheim Dragon School.

They secretly work with sound-based spells,
and never reveal themselves.

armor.name: Black Sorcerer Hat
armor.description:
Hat worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim
Dragon School.

They secretly work with sound-based spells,
and never reveal themselves.

armor.name: Black Tights
armor.description:
Tights worn by pardoners serving Velka,
the Goddess of Sin.

The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in
color and said to be imbued with Velka's
mystical power, which provides resistance
against all manner of magic.

armor.name: Blood-Stained Skirt
armor.description:
Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.

It is thought to have once been the white
skirt of a maiden, but its true origin
is lost in patches of blood. Perhaps its
former wearer was maimed to prevent escape?

armor.name: Boots of the Explorer
armor.description:
Strange boots from the ancient land of Zena,
birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.

The inlaid silver rings symbolize an
explorer.

armor.name: Bracelet of the Great Lord
armor.description:
Bracelets of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked
the First Flame.

Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul,
divided that power among his clan before
linking the flame. When he departed, he
left only with his greatsword, his garb,
and the crown, now bereft of power.

armor.name: Brass Armor
armor.description:
Armor of the Darkmoon Knightess,
Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.

After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark
Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral
Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon,
and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She
received this armor, which hides her hideous
form and helps her hunt the guilty.

armor.name: Brass Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the Darkmoon Knightess,
Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.

After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark
Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral
Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon,
and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She
received these gauntlets, which hide her
hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

armor.name: Brass Helm
armor.description:
Helm of the Darkmoon Knightess,
Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.

After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark
Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral
Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon,
and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She
received this helm, which hides her hideous
form and helps her hunt the guilty.

armor.name: Brass Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of the Darkmoon Knightess,
Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.

After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark
Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral
Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon,
and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She
received these leggings, which hide her
hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

armor.name: Brigand Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by the brigands who raid mountain
hamlets and attack travelers.

The addition of metal over a base of cloth
and leather offers good mobility and defense.

armor.name: Brigand Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by the brigands who raid
mountain hamlets and attack travelers.

The addition of metal over a base of cloth
and leather offers good mobility and defense.

armor.name: Brigand Hood
armor.description:
Hood worn by the brigands who raid mountain
hamlets and attack travelers.

In addition to protecting against the blazing
sun, dust, and sand, it helps them tell
friend from foe in the heat of battle.

armor.name: Brigand Trousers
armor.description:
Trousers worn by the brigands who raid
mountain hamlets and attack travelers.

The addition of metal over a base of cloth
and leather offers good mobility and defense.

armor.name: Catarina Armor
armor.description:
Distinctively shaped armor worn by the
Knights of Catarina.

Outside Catarina, it is often ridiculed for
its onion-like shape, infuriating the proud
knights, but the masterfully forged curved
design makes it very effective for parrying.

armor.name: Catarina Gauntlets
armor.description:
Distinctively shaped gauntlets worn by the
Knights of Catarina.

Outside Catarina, they are often ridiculed
for their onion-like shape, infuriating the
proud knights, but the masterfully forged
curved design makes it very effective for
parrying.

armor.name: Catarina Helm
armor.description:
Distinctively shaped helm worn by the
Knights of Catarina.

Outside Catarina, it is often ridiculed for
its onion-like shape, infuriating the proud
knights, but the masterfully forged curved
design makes it very effective for parrying.

armor.name: Catarina Leggings
armor.description:
Distinctively shaped leggings worn by the
Knights of Catarina.

Outside Catarina, they are often ridiculed
for their onion-like shape, infuriating the
proud knights, but the masterfully forged
curved design makes it very effective for
parrying.

armor.name: Chain Armor
armor.description:
Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of
steel. It is common throughout the human
world since it can be easily produced, is not
too heavy, and offers good defense.

Knights may favor flashy armor, but for
warriors on the battlefield, anything is
fine as long as it keeps them alive.

armor.name: Chain Helm
armor.description:
A chainmail helm of thin interlinking rings
of steel. It is common throughout the human
world since it can be easily produced, is not
too heavy, and offers good defense.

Knights may favor flashy armor, but for
warriors on the battlefield, anything is
fine as long as it keeps them alive.

armor.name: Chain Leggings
armor.description:
Chainmail leggings of thin interlinking
rings of steel. It is common throughout the
human world since it can be easily produced,
is not too heavy, and offers good defense.

Knights may favor flashy armor, but for
warriors on the battlefield, anything is
fine as long as it keeps them alive.

armor.name: Cleric Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

It is rather substantial in size and weight,
making its wearer look even bigger than he
actually is.

armor.name: Cleric Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

They are rather substantial in size and
weight, making its wearer look even bigger
than he actually is.

armor.name: Cleric Helm
armor.description:
Helm worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

It is rather substantial in size and weight,
making its wearer look even bigger than he
actually is.

armor.name: Cleric Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

They are rather substantial in size and
weight, making its wearer look even bigger
than he actually is.

armor.name: Crimson Gloves
armor.description:
Gloves of the sorcerers who flooded
New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths,
and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.

The Sealers were once known as healers, and
the bright crimson was a symbol of that.

armor.name: Crimson Robe
armor.description:
Robe of the sorcerers who flooded
New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths,
and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.

The Sealers were once known as healers, and
the bright crimson was a symbol of that.

armor.name: Crimson Waistcloth
armor.description:
Waistcloth of the sorcerers who flooded
New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths,
and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.

The Sealers were once known as healers, and
the bright crimson was a symbol of that.

armor.name: Crown of Dusk
armor.description:
Special magic crown bestowed upon Dusk,
Princess of Oolacile, upon her birth.

Its wearer is blessed by all manner of magic.
This raises the power and effect of the
wearer's magic, but damage suffered by magic
attacks also rises.

armor.name: Crown of the Dark Sun
armor.description:
Crown of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector
of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.

This crown of the gods demands faith
immeasurable of its wearer, but it is imbued
with Darkmoon power that enhances all magic.
The image of the sun manifests Gwyndolin's
deep adoration of the sun.

armor.name: Crown of the Great Lord
armor.description:
Crown of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked
the First Flame.

Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul,
divided his power among his great clan before
linking the flame. But he did keep his crown,
perhaps to preserve a symbol of the monarch,
for its actual power had fully subsided.

armor.name: Crystalline Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by a Hollowed knight, who was
partially crystallized.

The crystal provides powerful defense, but
it cannot be used for long because it is
easily broken and cannot be repaired.

armor.name: Crystalline Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by a Hollowed knight, who was
partially crystallized.

The crystal provides strong defense, but
they cannot be used for long because they
are easily broken and cannot be repaired.

armor.name: Crystalline Helm
armor.description:
Helm worn by a Hollowed knight, who was
partially crystallized.

The crystal provides powerful defense,
but it cannot be used for long because it is
easily broken and cannot be repaired.

armor.name: Crystalline Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings worn by a Hollowed knight, who was
partially crystallized.

The crystal power provides good defense, but
they cannot be used for long because they
are easily broken and cannot be repaired.

armor.name: Dark Armor
armor.description:
Armor of the Darkwraiths, former knights of
New Londo who descended into Dark.

Their armor transformed, and remains a
symbol of the Dark servants and their
diabolical art of Lifedrain.

armor.name: Dark Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the Darkwraiths, former knights
of New Londo who descended into Dark.

Their gauntlets transformed, and remain
symbol of the Dark servants and their
diabolical art of Lifedrain.

armor.name: Dark Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of the Darkwraiths, former knights
of New Londo who descended into Dark.

Their leggings transformed, and remain a
symbol of the Dark servants and their
diabolical art of Lifedrain.

armor.name: Dark Mask
armor.description:
Mask of the Darkwraiths, former knights of
New Londo who descended into Dark.

Some say the skeletal mask of an ancient
Darkwraith is partially fused with the flesh
of its face.

armor.name: Dingy Gloves
armor.description:
Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.

They are thought to have once been the white
gloves of a maiden, but smoke and ashes
from bonfires have darkened them over the
years.

armor.name: Dingy Hood
armor.description:
Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.

It is thought to have once been the white
hood of a maiden, but smoke and ashes
from bonfires have darkened it over the
years.

armor.name: Dingy Robe
armor.description:
Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.

It is thought to have once been the white
robe of a maiden, but smoke and ashes
from bonfires have darkened it over the
years.

armor.name: Eastern Armor
armor.description:
Distinctive armor made in an Eastern Land.

Exquisitely crafted, this armor offers
excellent defense, particularly versus slash
attacks, which are one of the main threats in
battles in the East.

armor.name: Eastern Gauntlets
armor.description:
Distinctive gauntlets made in an Eastern
land.

Exquisitely crafted, these gauntlets offer
excellent defense, particularly versus slash
attacks, which are one of the main threats in
battles in the East.

armor.name: Eastern Helm
armor.description:
A distinctive helm made in an Eastern land.

Exquisitely crafted, this helm offers
excellent defense, particularly versus slash
attacks, which are one of the main threats in
battles in the East.

armor.name: Eastern Leggings
armor.description:
Distinctive leggings made in an Eastern
land.

Exquisitely crafted, these leggings offer
excellent defense, particularly versus slash
attacks, which are one of the main threats in
battles in the East.

armor.name: Elite Cleric Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

Among such armors, those that were black
belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions,
many of whom were high-level priests.

armor.name: Elite Cleric Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

Among such gauntlets, those that were black
belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions,
many of whom were high-level priests.

armor.name: Elite Cleric Helm
armor.description:
Helm worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

Among such helms, those that were black
belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions,
many of whom were high-level priests.

armor.name: Elite Cleric Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings worn by the warrior clerics of the
Way of White, who are famous for being
unyielding in battle.

Among such leggings, those that were black
belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions,
many of whom were high-level priests.

armor.name: Elite Knight Armor
armor.description:
Armor of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite
knight of Astora, based on the fire-warding
heraldic symbol on its blue surcoat.

Although he was loath to give up on his
Undead mission, he perished at the Undead
Asylum, and went Hollow.

armor.name: Elite Knight Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of a nameless knight, perhaps an
elite knight of Astora.

Although he was loath to give up on his
Undead mission, he perished at the Undead
Asylum, and went Hollow.

armor.name: Elite Knight Helm
armor.description:
Helm of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite
knight of Astora.

Although he was loath to give up on his
Undead mission, he perished at the Undead
Asylum, and went Hollow.

armor.name: Elite Knight Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of a nameless knight, perhaps an
elite knight of Astora.

Although he was loath to give up on his
Undead mission, he perished at the Undead
Asylum, and went Hollow.

armor.name: Embraced Armor of Favor
armor.description:
Armor of Lautrec the Embraced,
representing the goddess Fina's love.

The goddess's arms wrap around it, as if to
embrace the wearer.

armor.name: Fang Boar Helm
armor.description:
Severed head of the fully-armored Fang Boar
taken by the one who killed it as proof of
his victory, just as the Gods once did with
the head of the ancient dragon.

Can be worn on the head as a surprisingly
sound piece of protective gear.

armor.name: Gargoyle Helm
armor.description:
Helm of the gargoyle, an enchanted creature
that guarded the Bell of Awakening in the
belfry of the Undead Church.

This bronze helm was for mere appearance's
sake, as gargoyle skin is naturally hard.
Little in the way of defense can be expected
from it.

armor.name: Gauntlets of Favor
armor.description:
Gauntlets of Lautrec the Embraced,
representing the goddess Fina's love.

During his solitude, he forsook everything,
for he believed in the goddess's love for
him.

armor.name: Gauntlets of Thorns
armor.description:
Gauntlets of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and
notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense
patch of thorns grows from their surface.

They are fitting items for the murderous
Kirk, for by simply wearing them and rolling,
one can damage enemies.

armor.name: Gauntlets of the Channelers
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the Channelers, sorcerers that
serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the
onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers,"
as they were often called, ventured to far
lands to find suitable human specimens.

The heaviest of protective gear for
sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

armor.name: Gauntlets of the Vanquisher
armor.description:
Strange gauntlets from the ancient land of
Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer
Domhnall.

The gold bracelets symbolize a vanquisher.

armor.name: Giant Armor
armor.description:
Armor of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.

Made from ancient brass, it also offers
protection versus non-physical attacks, but
due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy
for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

armor.name: Giant Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the giant sentinels of Anor
Londo.

Made from ancient brass, they also offer
protection versus non-physical attacks, but
due to their giant size, they are extremely
heavy for humans, and impede stamina
recovery.

armor.name: Giant Helm
armor.description:
Helm of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.

Made from ancient brass, it also offers
protection versus non-physical attacks, but
due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy
for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

armor.name: Giant Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of the giant sentinels of Anor
Londo.

Made from ancient brass, they also offer
protection versus non-physical attacks, but
due to their giant size, they are extremely
heavy for humans, and impede stamina
recovery.

armor.name: Gold-Hemmed Black Cloak
armor.description:
Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother
of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.

She wore this gold-hemmed black cloak
before even the Age of Fire, and it offers
strong resistance versus fire, poison, and
other perils.

armor.name: Gold-Hemmed Black Gloves
armor.description:
Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother
of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.

She wore these gold-lined black gloves
before even the Age of Fire, and they offer
strong resistance versus fire, poison, and
other perils.

armor.name: Gold-Hemmed Black Hood
armor.description:
Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother
of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.

She wore this gold-hemmed black hood before
even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong
resistance versus fire, poison, and other
perils.

armor.name: Gold-Hemmed Black Skirt
armor.description:
Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, founder
of pyromancy and one of the Daughters of
Chaos.

She wore this gold-hemmed black skirt before
even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong
resistance versus fire, poison, and other
perils.

armor.name: Golem Armor
armor.description:
Body of the Iron Golem, guardian of the
ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who
ventured forth to Anor Londo.

Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron,
and can be equipped as solid protective gear,
but its immense weight hinders stamina
recovery.

armor.name: Golem Gauntlets
armor.description:
Arms of the Iron Golem, guardian of the
ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who
ventured forth to Anor Londo.

Without its core, they are mere hunks of
iron, and can be equipped as solid protective
gear, but their immense weight hinders
stamina recovery.

armor.name: Golem Helm
armor.description:
Head of the Iron Golem, guardian of the
ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who
ventured forth to Anor Londo.

Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron,
and can be equipped as solid protective gear,
but its immense weight hinders stamina
recovery.

armor.name: Golem Leggings
armor.description:
Legs of the Iron Golem, guardian of the
ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who
ventured forth to Anor Londo.

Without its core, they are mere hunks of
iron, and can be equipped as solid protective
gear, but their immense weight hinders
stamina recovery.

armor.name: Hard Leather Armor
armor.description:
Armor made of thick leather. Very common
type of protective gear, it provides
a sound level of defense.

armor.name: Hard Leather Boots
armor.description:
Boots made of thick leather. Very common
type of protective gear, they provide
a sound level of defense.

armor.name: Hard Leather Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets made of thick leather. Very
common type of protective gear, they
provide a sound level of defense.

armor.name: Havel's Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by Havel the Rock's warriors.
Carved from solid rock, its tremendous weight
is matched only by the defense it provides.

Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated
from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face
them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

armor.name: Havel's Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by Havel the Rock's warriors.
Carved from solid rock, their
tremendous weight is matched only by the
defense they provide.

Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated
from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face
them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

armor.name: Havel's Helm
armor.description:
Helm worn by Havel the Rock's warriors.
Carved from solid rock, its tremendous weight
is matched only by the defense it provides.

Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated
from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face
them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

armor.name: Havel's Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings worn by Havel the Rock's warriors.
Carved from solid rock, their tremendous
weight is matched only by the defense they
provide.

Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated
from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face
them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

armor.name: Heavy Boots
armor.description:
Boots made of thick leather. The boots of the
pyromancers are incredibly tough, on account
of the rugged grasslands and treacherous
swamps they must traverse. Their soles are
nearly impenetrable.

armor.name: Helm of Favor
armor.description:
Helm of Lautrec the Embraced,
representing the goddess Fina's love.

During his solitude, he forsook everything,
for he believed in the goddess's love for
him.

armor.name: Helm of Thorns
armor.description:
Helm of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and notorious
member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of
thorns grows from its surface.

It is a fitting item for the murderous Kirk,
for by simply wearing it and rolling, one can
damage enemies.

armor.name: Helm of the Wise
armor.description:
A strange helm from the ancient land of Zena,
birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.

The two horns are believed to symbolize
wisdom.

armor.name: Hollow Soldier Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be
old and battered, but its iron construction
makes it quite sturdy.

armor.name: Hollow Soldier Helm
armor.description:
Helm worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old
and battered, but its iron construction makes
it quite sturdy.

It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head
protection against arrows and other physical
threats.

armor.name: Hollow Soldier Waistcloth
armor.description:
Waistcloth worn by Hollow soldiers. It is so
tattered that it barely serves its purpose
anymore.

armor.name: Hollow Thief's Hood
armor.description:
Hood worn by Hollow thieves.
Used to hide a guilty countenance.

armor.name: Hollow Thief's Leather Armor
armor.description:
Leather armor worn by Hollow thieves. It
stifles noise and helps its wearer hide in
the shadows.

armor.name: Hollow Thief's Tights
armor.description:
Tights worn by Hollow thieves. They stifle
noise and help their wearer hide in the
shadows.

armor.name: Hollow Warrior Armor
armor.description:
Armor worn by Hollow warriors. It is made of
thick leather that is tattered with age.

armor.name: Hollow Warrior Helm
armor.description:
Helm worn by Hollow warriors. Although it is
made of iron, it is old, battered and worn
out.

It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head
protection against arrows and other physical
threats.

armor.name: Hollow Warrior Waistcloth
armor.description:
Waistcloth worn by Hollow warriors. It is so
tattered that it barely serves its purpose
anymore.

armor.name: Holy Robe
armor.description:
Robe donned by men of the cloth. Though plain
to the eye, its hardy fabric repels rain and
keeps the body warm.

Those dissatisfied with church teachings
must test their faith by going on a spiritual
journey. Such is the ritual self-purification
of the Way of White.

armor.name: Holy Trousers
armor.description:
Trousers donned by men of the cloth. Though
plain to the eye, their hardy fabric
repels rain and keeps the body warm.

Those dissatisfied with church teachings
must test their faith by going on a spiritual
journey. Such is the ritual self-purification
of the Way of White.

armor.name: Iron Bracelet
armor.description:
Bracelets of Solaire of Astora, Knight of
Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any
particular powers.

Solaire's incredible prowess must have
come from rigorous training alone, for
his equipment exhibits no special traits.

armor.name: Iron Helm
armor.description:
Helm of Solaire of Astora, Knight of
Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any
particular powers.

Solaire's incredible prowess must have
come from rigorous training alone, for
his equipment exhibits no special traits.

armor.name: Iron Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of Solaire of Astora, Knight of
Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any
particular powers.

Solaire's incredible prowess must have
come from rigorous training alone, for
his equipment exhibits no special traits.

armor.name: Knight Armor
armor.description:
Armor of a lower-rank knight. Despite the
thin metal used, the grooved texture gives
it added protection.

armor.name: Knight Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of a lower-rank knight. Despite the
thin metal used, the grooved texture gives
them added protection.

armor.name: Knight Helm
armor.description:
Helm of a lower-rank knight. Despite the
thin metal used, the grooved texture gives
it added protection.

armor.name: Knight Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of a lower-rank knight. Despite the
thin metal used, the grooved texture gives
them added protection.

armor.name: Leather Armor
armor.description:
Armor made of soft leather.
Very common type of protective gear.

armor.name: Leather Boots
armor.description:
Boots made of soft leather.
Very common type of protective gear.

armor.name: Leather Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets made of soft leather. One of the
more common kinds of protective gear.

armor.name: Leather Gloves
armor.description:
Gloves made of soft leather.
Very common type of protective gear.

armor.name: Leggings of Favor
armor.description:
Leggings of Lautrec the Embraced,
representing the goddess Fina's love.

During his solitude, he forsook everything,
for he believed in the goddess's love for
him.

armor.name: Leggings of Thorns
armor.description:
Leggings of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and
notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense
patch of thorns grows from their surface.

They are fitting items for the murderous
Kirk, for by simply wearing them and rolling,
one can damage enemies.

armor.name: Mage Smith Boots
armor.description:
Boots worn by proper mage smiths who
studied at Vinheim Dragon School.

Mage smiths learn their craft alongside
sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to
forging weapons with magic embers.

armor.name: Mage Smith Coat
armor.description:
Coat worn by proper mage smiths who
studied at Vinheim Dragon School.

Mage smiths learn their craft alongside
sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to
forging weapons with magic embers.

armor.name: Mage Smith Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by proper mage smiths who
studied at Vinheim Dragon School.

Mage smiths learn their craft alongside
sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to
forging weapons with magic embers.

armor.name: Mage Smith Hat
armor.description:
Hat worn by proper mage smiths who
studied at Vinheim Dragon School.

Mage smiths learn their craft alongside
sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to
forging weapons with magic embers.

armor.name: Maiden Gloves
armor.description:
White gloves worn by traveling maidens.
They are part of their formal attire,
regardless of rank.

While soft and well-made, they do not
offer much in the way of defense, making
them ill-suited to use in battle.

armor.name: Maiden Hood
armor.description:
White hood worn by traveling maidens. It is
part of their formal attire, regardless of
rank.

It is soft and well-made, but does not offer
much in the way of defense, making it ill-
suited to use in battle.

armor.name: Maiden Robe
armor.description:
White robe worn by traveling maidens. It is
part of their formal attire, regardless of
rank.

It is soft and well-made, but does not offer
much in the way of defense, making it ill-
suited to use in battle.

armor.name: Maiden Skirt
armor.description:
White skirt worn by traveling maidens.
It is part of their formal attire, regardless
of rank.

It is soft and well-made, but does not offer
much in the way of defense, making it ill-
suited to use in battle.

armor.name: Mask of Velka
armor.description:
Mask worn by pardoners serving Velka,
the Goddess of Sin.

The pardoners listen to the confessions of
sinners, urging reflection and salvation.
Their masks symbolize separation from
worldly desires.

armor.name: Mask of the Child
armor.description:
One of the three masks of the Pinwheel,
the necromancer who stole the power of the
Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.

This mask, belonging to the naive child,
slightly raises stamina recovery speed.

armor.name: Mask of the Father
armor.description:
One of the three masks of the Pinwheel,
the necromancer who stole the power of the
Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.

This mask, belonging to the valiant father,
slightly raises equipment load.

armor.name: Mask of the Mother
armor.description:
One of the three masks of the Pinwheel,
the necromancer who stole the power of the
Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.

This mask, belonging to the kindly mother,
slightly raises HP.

armor.name: Mask of the Sealer
armor.description:
Mask of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo
to seal away the Darkwraiths, and the
Four Kings who descended into Dark.

It symbolizes their resolve to keep the seal
shut forever and their atonement for all who
were sacrificed, but two of the three forsook
New Londo upon tiring of their duty.

armor.name: Moonlight Gloves
armor.description:
Gloves of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector
of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.

The power of the moon was strong in
Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a
daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin,
and hardly provides any physical defense.

armor.name: Moonlight Robe
armor.description:
Robe of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector
of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.

The power of the moon was strong in
Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a
daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin,
and hardly provides any physical defense.

armor.name: Moonlight Waistcloth
armor.description:
Waistcloth of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin,
protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.

The power of the moon was strong in
Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a
daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin,
and hardly provides any physical defense.

armor.name: Ornstein's Armor
armor.description:
Armor of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who
guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of
Anor Londo.

Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the
Four Knights. His golden lion armor is imbued
with the power of lightning and should
provide good protection against it.

armor.name: Ornstein's Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who
guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of
Anor Londo.

Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the
Four Knights. His golden lion gauntlets are
imbued with the power of lightning and should
provide good protection against it.

armor.name: Ornstein's Helm
armor.description:
Helm of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who
guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of
Anor Londo.

Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the
Four Knights. His golden lion helm is imbued
with the power of lightning and should
provide good protection against it.

armor.name: Ornstein's Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who
guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of
Anor Londo.

Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the
Four Knights. His golden lion leggings are
imbued with the power of lightning and should
provide good protection against it.

armor.name: Painting Guardian Gloves
armor.description:
Gloves worn by the alabaster-clothed 
guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo.
Offer substantial protection versus magic.

They have guarded the Great Paintings of
Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down
through the generations, but the reason for
doing so passed from all memory long ago.

armor.name: Painting Guardian Hood
armor.description:
Hood worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians
of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offers
substantial protection versus magic.

They have guarded the Great Paintings of
Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down
through the generations, but the reason for
doing so passed from all memory long ago.

armor.name: Painting Guardian Robe
armor.description:
Robe worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians
of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offers
substantial protection versus magic.

They have guarded the Great Paintings of
Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down
through the generations, but the reason for
doing so passed from all memory long ago.

armor.name: Painting Guardian Waistcloth
armor.description:
Waistcloth worn by the alabaster-clothed 
guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo.
Offers substantial protection versus magic.

They have guarded the Great Paintings of
Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down
through the generations, but the reason for
doing so passed from all memory long ago.

armor.name: Paladin Armor
armor.description:
Armor of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.

Long ago, the Way of White produced its
first Undead, a paladin in golden armor.
With the legendary treasures Grant and
Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran,
Land of the Gods, in the first Undead
mission of the Way of White.

armor.name: Paladin Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of Leeroy, Paladin of the
Catacombs.

Long ago, the Way of White produced its
first Undead, a paladin in golden armor.
With the legendary treasures Grant and
Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran,
Land of the Gods, in the first Undead
mission of the Way of White.

armor.name: Paladin Helm
armor.description:
Helm of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.

Long ago, the Way of White produced its
first Undead, a paladin in golden armor.
With the legendary treasures Grant and
Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran,
Land of the Gods, in the first Undead
mission of the Way of White.

armor.name: Paladin Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.

Long ago, the Way of White produced its
first Undead, a paladin in golden armor.
With the legendary treasures Grant and
Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran,
Land of the Gods, in the first Undead
mission of the Way of White.

armor.name: Pharis's Hat
armor.description:
Broad-brimmed hat favored by the archer hero
Pharis.

Pharis was an accomplished archer, and though
he was human, he ranked alongside Hawkeye
Gough, one of the Four Knights of Lord
Gwyn. His hat is universally popular among
children.

armor.name: Priest's Hat
armor.description:
Distinctive hat worn only by Way of White
priests in Thorolund.

It is simply meant to show their position
within the hierarchy. It holds almost no
meaning in the land of Lordran.

armor.name: Robe of the Channelers
armor.description:
Robe of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve
Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of
Seath's madness, the "snatchers," as they
were often called, ventured to far lands to
find suitable human specimens.

The heaviest of protective gear for
sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

armor.name: Robe of the Great Lord
armor.description:
Robe of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked
the First Flame.

Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul,
divided that power among his clan before
linking the flame. When he departed, he
left only with his greatsword, his garb,
and the crown, now bereft of power.

armor.name: Royal Helm
armor.description:
Helm of Vamos, skeleton blacksmith of the
Catacombs. Partially made of gold, and
confers high resistance overall.

The helm is believed to belong to an ancient
royal line, but only Vamos would know for
sure, and he shall never speak again.

armor.name: Sack
armor.description:
Bloodstained patchwork sack by the Undead
man-eating cook lurking in the Depths. Two
eyeholes have been haphazardly cut out.

It is unexpectedly soft and comfortable to
wear, but it is probably near meaningless
in terms of defense.

armor.name: Sage Robe
armor.description:
Robe worn by Big Hat Logan. It is said to
have been from his apprentice days at Dragon
School, but it is so worn out, no one knows
what it originally looked like.

Logan, who cared little for his appearance,
no doubt ever bothered to change out of it.

armor.name: Shadow Garb
armor.description:
Black cloth garb worn by spooks from an
Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder
their unique form of martial arts.

While it sacrifices defense for the sake of
greater mobility, it does offer resistance
to bleeding and poison among other things,
perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

armor.name: Shadow Gauntlets
armor.description:
Black cloth gauntlets worn by spooks from an
Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder
their unique form of martial arts.

While they sacrifice defense for the sake of
greater mobility, they do offer resistance
to bleeding and poison among other things,
perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

armor.name: Shadow Leggings
armor.description:
Black cloth leggings worn by spooks from an
Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder
their unique form of martial arts.

While they sacrifice defense for the sake of
greater mobility, they do offer resistance
to bleeding and poison among other things,
perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

armor.name: Shadow Mask
armor.description:
Black cloth mask worn by spooks from an
Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder
their unique form of martial arts.

While it sacrifices defense for the sake of
greater mobility, it does offer resistance
to bleeding and poison among other things,
perhaps due to the nature of their duties.

armor.name: Silver Knight Armor
armor.description:
Armor of the Silver Knights who protect Anor
Londo.

When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire,
his knights split into two groups. The Silver
Knights remained in the forsaken capital in
the service of their goddess.

armor.name: Silver Knight Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the Silver Knights who protect
Anor Londo.

When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire,
his knights split into two groups. The Silver
Knights remained in the forsaken capital in
the service of their goddess.

armor.name: Silver Knight Helm
armor.description:
Helm of the Silver Knights who protect Anor
Londo.

When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire,
his knights split into two groups. The Silver
Knights remained in the forsaken capital in
the service of their goddess.

armor.name: Silver Knight Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of the Silver Knights who protect
Anor Londo.

When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire,
