his knights split into two groups. The Silver
Knights remained in the forsaken capital in
the service of their goddess.

armor.name: Six-Eyed Helm of the Channelers
armor.description:
Helm of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve
Seath the Scaleless. The six eyes arranged
in two vertical columns compensate for
Seath's lack of sight.

The heaviest of protective gear for
sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

armor.name: Smough's Armor
armor.description:
Armor of Smough, the Executioner, protector
of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor
Londo. It offers extremely high defense
and can be worn by humans, but not
without great difficulty.

armor.name: Smough's Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of Smough, the Executioner, protector
of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor
Londo. It offers extremely high defense
and can be worn by humans, but not
without great difficulty.

armor.name: Smough's Helm
armor.description:
Helm of Smough, the Executioner, protector
of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor
Londo. It offers extremely high defense
and can be worn by humans, but not
without great difficulty.

armor.name: Smough's Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of Smough, the Executioner, protector
of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor
Londo. It offers extremely high defense
and can be worn by humans, but not
without great difficulty.

armor.name: Sorcerer Boots
armor.description:
Boots worn by proper sorcerers who studied
at Vinheim Dragon School.

The majority take pride in having studied at
the academy and look down on breaking the
formal dress code established for sorcerers.

armor.name: Sorcerer Cloak
armor.description:
Cloak worn by proper sorcerers who
studied at Vinheim Dragon School.

The majority take pride in having studied at
the academy and look down on breaking the
formal dress code established for sorcerers.

armor.name: Sorcerer Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets worn by proper sorcerers who
studied at Vinheim Dragon School.

The majority take pride in having studied at
the academy and look down on breaking the
formal dress code established for sorcerers.

armor.name: Sorcerer Hat
armor.description:
Hat worn by proper sorcerers who
studied at Vinheim Dragon School.

The majority take pride in having studied at
the academy and look down on breaking the
formal dress code established for sorcerers.

armor.name: Standard Helm
armor.description:
A sturdy helm made of iron. Very common
type of protective gear, it provides
a sound level of defense.

It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head
protection against arrows and other physical
threats.

armor.name: Steel Armor
armor.description:
Armor of the Knights of Berenike, known for
their heavy armaments and armor.

Countless Knights of Berenike, once
extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became
Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their
journey was for naught, as they went Hollow,
and became a threat to all Undead.

armor.name: Steel Gauntlets
armor.description:
Gauntlets of the Knights of Berenike, known
for their heavy armaments and armor.

Countless Knights of Berenike, once
extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became
Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their
journey was for naught, as they went Hollow,
and became a threat to all Undead.

armor.name: Steel Helm
armor.description:
Helm of the Knights of Berenike, known for
their heavy armaments and armor.

Countless Knights of Berenike, once
extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became
Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their
journey was for naught, as they went Hollow,
and became a threat to all Undead.

armor.name: Steel Leggings
armor.description:
Leggings of the Knights of Berenike, known
for their heavy armaments and armor.

Countless Knights of Berenike, once
extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became
Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their
journey was for naught, as they went Hollow,
and became a threat to all Undead.

armor.name: Stone Armor
armor.description:
Moss-covered armor of the Stone Knight,
defender of the Darkroot Garden.

The Stone Knight is a product of ancient
magic, and although this armor is also imbued
with magic, it is incredibly heavy.

armor.name: Stone Gauntlets
armor.description:
Moss-covered gauntlets of the Stone Knight,
defender of the Darkroot Garden.

The Stone Knight is a product of ancient
magic, and although these gauntlets are also
imbued with magic, they are incredibly heavy.

armor.name: Stone Helm
armor.description:
Moss-covered helm of the Stone Knight,
defender of the Darkroot Garden.

The Stone Knight is a product of ancient
magic, and although this helm is also imbued
with magic, it is incredibly heavy.

armor.name: Stone Leggings
armor.description:
Moss-covered leggings of the Stone Knight,
defender of the Darkroot Garden.

The Stone Knight is a product of ancient
magic, and although these leggings are also
imbued with magic, they are incredible heavy.

armor.name: Sunlight Maggot
armor.description:
A loathsome parasite that inhabits Lost
Izalith. It is completely immobile, yet still
lives.

When worn on the head, it emanates
blinding light, which is why it is known
as a Sunlight Maggot.

armor.name: Symbol of Avarice
armor.description:
Monster head resembling a treasure chest.
Once an ancient god, it is said this is the
symbol of shame imposed on a long lost clan,
exiled for the sin of avarice.

Wearing this slightly raises soul absorption
and item discovery, but also affects its
wearer with the curse of the branded.

armor.name: Tattered Cloth Hood
armor.description:
Hood worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp.
Though it appears tattered, it is actually
quite strong.

Their attire offers substantial protection
against poison, fire, and other forces of
nature out in the hinterlands where they
were driven.

armor.name: Tattered Cloth Manchette
armor.description:
Manchette worn by pyromancers of the Great
Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is
actually quite strong.

Their attire offers substantial protection
against poison, fire, and other forces of
nature out in the hinterlands where they
were driven.

armor.name: Tattered Cloth Robe
armor.description:
Robe worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp.
Though it appears tattered, it is actually
quite strong.

Their attire offers substantial protection
against poison, fire, and other forces of
nature out in the hinterlands where they
were driven.

armor.name: Thief Mask
armor.description:
Mask of sinners. They hide their faces,
stifle their voices and hide in the shadows.
It does not provide much in the way of
defense.

armor.name: Traveling Boots
armor.description:
Boots worn by Big Hat Logan. They are
indistinguishable from the ordinary kind
worn by travelers.

armor.name: Traveling Gloves
armor.description:
Thick, sturdy gloves made for travelers on
extended journeys.

armor.name: Traveling Gloves
armor.description:
Gloves worn by Big Hat Logan. They are
indistinguishable from the ordinary kind
worn by travelers.

armor.name: Waistcloth of the Channelers
armor.description:
Waistcloth of the Channelers, sorcerers that
serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the
onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers,"
as they were often called, ventured to far
lands to find suitable human specimens.

The heaviest of protective gear for
sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

armor.name: Wanderer Boots
armor.description:
Boots of an aimless traveler.

Made from sturdy leather. A must-have for
long journeys.

armor.name: Wanderer Coat
armor.description:
Coat of an aimless traveler. Made from sturdy
leather and quilting.

Battle comes with the territory when one
wanders the land, and this coat provides a
certain degree of protection.

armor.name: Wanderer Hood
armor.description:
Hood of an aimless traveler. Made from sturdy
leather, it offers protection versus wind
and rain.

armor.name: Wanderer Manchette
armor.description:
Manchette of an aimless traveler.

Made from sturdy leather and protects the
hands.

armor.name: Witch Cloak
armor.description:
Cloak of the rogue witch Beatrice.

Almost all magic users that employ catalysts
studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is
one of the few exceptions. She braved the
Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

armor.name: Witch Gloves
armor.description:
Gloves of the rogue witch Beatrice.

Almost all magic users that employ catalysts
studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is
one of the few exceptions. She braved the
Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

armor.name: Witch Hat
armor.description:
Hat of the rogue witch Beatrice.

Almost all magic users that employ a wand
studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is
one of the few exceptions. She braved the
Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

armor.name: Witch Skirt
armor.description:
Skirt of the rogue witch Beatrice.

Almost all magic users that employ catalysts
studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is
one of the few exceptions. She braved the
Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

armor.name: Xanthous Crown
armor.description:
A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous 
King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one
knows where it came from.

The crown bears high-quality cloth which is
quite soft to the touch, but its bright
yellow color stings the eyes, and it is
clearly far too big.

armor.name: Xanthous Gloves
armor.description:
Mysterious items once worn by the Xanthous
King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one
knows where they came from.

They may be tattered, but their bright yellow
color still stings the eyes.

armor.name: Xanthous Overcoat
armor.description:
A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous
King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one
knows where it came from.

It may be tattered, but its bright yellow
color still stings the eyes.

armor.name: Xanthous Waistcloth
armor.description:
A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous
King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one
knows where it came from.

It may be tattered, but its bright yellow
color still stings the eyes.

rings.name: Bellowing Dragoncrest Ring
rings.description:
A special ring granted to only the most accomplished sorcerers at the Vinheim Dragon School.
The ring is engraved with an everlasting dragon, and boosts the strength of sorceries.

rings.name: Bloodbite Ring
rings.description:
One of the infamous bite rings commissioned by Sir Arstor of Carim.
Despite the dreadful rumors surrounding its creation, this ring is an unmistakable asset, in its ability to help prevent bleeding.

rings.name: Blue Tearstone Ring
rings.effect: Boosts DEF while HP is low
rings.description:
The rare gem called tearstone has the uncanny ability to sense imminent death.
This blue tearstone from Catarina boosts the defence of its wearer when in danger.

rings.name: Cat Covenant Ring
rings.description:
Ring granted to those bound by the Forest Hunter covenant.
The white cat Alvina speaks a human tongue and has lived since the early Age of Fire. Alvina was a trusted friend of Knight Artorias and the Great Wolf Sif.

rings.name: Cloranthy Ring
rings.description:
This ancient ring, engraved with a large green flower, is of unknown origin.
Hastens the regeneration of stamina.

rings.name: Covenant of Artorias
rings.description:
This ring symbolizes Knight Artorias' covenant with the beasts of the Abyss.
Its wearer, like Artorias himself, can traverse the abyss.

rings.name: Covetous Gold Serpent Ring
rings.description:
The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. Its habit of devouring prey even larger than itself has led to an association with gluttony.
This gold ring, engraved with the serpent, boosts its wearer's item discovery, so that more items can be amassed.

rings.name: Covetous Silver Serpent Ring
rings.effect: Additional souls absorbed for each kill
rings.description:
The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. Its habit of devouring prey even larger than itself has led to an association with gluttony.
This silver ring, engraved with the serpent, rewards its wearer with additional souls for each kill.

rings.name: Cursebite Ring
rings.description:
One of the infamous bite rings commissioned by Sir Arstor of Carim.
Despite the dreadful rumors surrounding its creation, this ring is an unmistakable asset, in its ability to help prevent curses.

rings.name: Dark Wood Grain Ring
rings.description:
This special ring crafted in an Eastern land is made of gold, but with a wood grain crest on its surface.
Agents of subterfuge in this faraway land are particularly fond of the dark gold wood grain, which greatly alters the player's rolling motion.

rings.name: Darkmoon Blade Covenant Ring
rings.description:
Ring granted to those bound by the Darkmoon Blade Covenant. Answer Dark Sun Gwyndolin's summoning.
Gwyndolin, all too aware of his repulsive, frail appearance, created the illusion of a sister Gwynevere, who helps him guard over Anor Londo. An unmasking of these deities would be tantamount to blasphemy.

rings.name: Darkmoon Seance Ring
rings.description:
This ring is granted to adherents of Gwyndolin, Darkmoon deity and last born of Gwyn, Lord of Sunlight. Grants additional magic and attunement slots.
The Dark Sun Gwyndolin is the only remaining deity in Anor Londo. His followers are few, but their tasks are of vital importance.

rings.name: Dusk Crown Ring
rings.effect: Grants extra sorcery castings, but halves HP
rings.description:
This magic crown-shaped ring was granted to Princess Dusk of Oolacile upon her birth.
The ringstone allows its wearer to cast additional sorceries, but at the cost of one-half of HP.

rings.name: East Wood Grain Ring
rings.description:
This special ring crafted in an Eastern land is made of gold, but with a wood grain crest on its surface.
The ring slows the loss of weapon durability and is particularly useful to bearers of delicate swords crafted in the East.

rings.name: Flame Stoneplate Ring
rings.description:
Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships.
The red stoneplate symbolizes fire, and boosts defense against flame.

rings.name: Havel's Ring
rings.description:
This ring was named after Havel the Rock, Lord Gwyn's old battlefield compatriot.
Havel's men wore the ring to express faith in their leader and to carry a heavier load.

rings.name: Hawk Ring
rings.description:
One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn, The Hawk Ring belongs to Hawkeye Gough, who led the Greatarchers.
Boosts bow range, so that arrows fly like they were shot by Gough's great bow, which took down high-flying dragons.

rings.name: Hornet Ring
rings.description:
One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The Hornet Ring belonged to the Lord's Blade Ciaran.
By boosting critical attacks, its wearer can annihilate foes, as Ciaran's dagger laid waste to Lord Gwyn's enemies.

rings.name: Leo Ring
rings.effect: Boosts counter attacks of thrust weapons
rings.description: One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The Leo Ring belonged to Ornstein the Dragonslayer. His lugged spear is said to have sliced a boulder in two.

rings.name: Lingering Dragoncrest Ring
rings.description:
A special ring granted to only the most accomplished sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.
The ring is engraved with a lingering dragon, and boosts the length of the effects of sorceries.

rings.name: Old Witch's Ring
rings.effect: An old ring, with no known use
rings.description:
Old ring from an old witch.
Engraved minutely with indecipherable script, but seemingly useless.

rings.name: Orange Charred Ring
rings.description:
An orange ring enchanted by a witch. Reduces lava damage.
Since his sores were inflamed by lava from birth, his witch sisters gave him this special ring. But fool that he is, he readily dropped it, and from that spot, a terrible centipede demon was born.

rings.name: Poisonbite Ring
rings.description:
One of the infamous bite rings commissioned by Sir Arstor of Carim.
Despite the dreadful rumors surrounding its creation, this ring is an unmistakable asset, in its ability to help prevent poison.

rings.name: Rare Ring of Sacrifice
rings.effect: Die, lose nothing, nullify curse, ring breaks
rings.description: This mystical ring was created in a sacrificial rite of Velka, the Goddess of Sin. The magenta-shaded ring is especially rare. Its wearer will lose nothing upon death, and will be freed from any curse whatsoever, but the ring itself breaks.

rings.name: Red Tearstone Ring
rings.effect: Boosts ATK while HP is low
rings.description:
The rare gem called tearstone has the uncanny ability to sense imminent death.
This red tearstone from Carim boosts the attack of its wearer when in danger.

rings.name: Ring of Favor and Protection
rings.effect: Boosts HP, stamina, load. Breaks when removed.
rings.description:
A ring symbolizing the favor and protection of the goddess Fina, known in legend to possess "fateful beauty".
This ring boosts its wearer's HP, stamina, and max equipment load, but breaks if ever removed.

rings.name: Ring of Fog
rings.description:
Those who befriend Alvina are given this mysterious ring. It resembles a pearl with its robust pure-white fog.
This ring camouflages its wearer's presence, helping to prevent detection.

rings.name: Ring of Sacrifice
rings.effect: Lose nothing upon death, but ring breaks
rings.description:
This mystical ring was created in a sacrificial rite of Velka, the Goddess of Sin.
Its wearer will lose nothing upon death, but the ring itself breaks.

rings.name: Ring of Steel Protection
rings.description:
This ring belonged to the Knight King Rendal. It grants its wearer protection by boosting defense against physical attacks.
Of the many legends surrounding the Knight King Rendal, one of the more well-known speaks of his standing down a giant drake and slashing it to pieces.

rings.name: Ring of the Evil Eye
rings.description:
According to legend, this ring contains the spirit of the evil eye, a dark beast which assaulted Astora.
The strength of the evil eye does not waver, and HP is absorbed from fallen enemies.

rings.name: Ring of the Sun Princess
rings.description:
This ring is granted to those who enter a Covenant with Gwynevere, daughter of Lord Gwyn and the Princess of Sunlight. This slightly warm ring boosts the synergy of miracles.
The Princess of Sunlight Gwynevere left Anor Londo along many other deities, and later became wife to Flame God Flann.

rings.name: Ring of the Sun's Firstborn
rings.description:
Lord Gwyn's firstborn, who inherited the sunlight, once wore this ancient ring. Boosts the strength of miracles.
Lord Gwyn's firstborn was a god of war, but his foolishness led to a loss of the annals, and rescinding of his deific status. Today, even his name is not known.

rings.name: Rusted Iron Ring
rings.description:
This iron ring was used to shackle the guilty. It is terribly rusted, and faintly stained with blood.
Those who find this strange ring to their liking will be pleased to find it easier to gain footing on poor ground such as swamps.

rings.name: Slumbering Dragoncrest Ring
rings.description:
This ring was secretly worn by a certain surreptitious sorcerer at Vinheim Dragon School.
The ring is engraved with an everlasting dragon in silent slumber, and masks all sound emitting from its wearer.

rings.name: Speckled Stoneplate Ring
rings.effect: Slight boost for magic, fire, lightning DEF
rings.description:
Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships.
The precious rare speckled stoneplate grants a small boost to defence against magic, flame and lightning.

rings.name: Spell Stoneplate Ring
rings.description: Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships. The blue stoneplate symbolizes souls, and boost defense against magic.

rings.name: Thunder Stoneplate Ring
rings.description: Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships. The yellow stoneplate symbolizes thunder, and boost defense against lightning.

rings.name: Tiny Being's Ring
rings.description:
Ring made of an ancient tiny red jewel. Grants small increase to HP.
Rings grant powers large and small. Their discovery, and effective use, can make one's journey easier.

rings.name: White Seance Ring
rings.description:
A divine ring entrusted to the head bishop of the Way of White and apostle to Allfather Lloyd, uncle to Lord Gwyn. It grants additional attunement slots.
The head bishop of the Way of White is the guardian of law and caste, and one of the great royals of Thorolund.

rings.name: Wolf Ring
rings.description: One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The wolf ring belongs to Artorias the Abysswalker.  Artorias had an unbendable will of steel, and was unmatched with a greatsword.
